posts.subject: Zeronet is a well crafted effort but it's hard to sense it's envelope
posts.body:
when only a single party really is involved with it.

For instance, it would be nice to know just how resistant a Zeronet server is to external mischief and just how much it protects the Tor browser from compromise. Since a properly configured Tor browser gets ALL of it's data from a local Zeronet instance - it should be shielded from direct attack. And given the server is much "stupider" than any browser since it has a more limited web access capability - one would think Zeronet would be a much harder app than the Tor browser? So what is our effective yield here? Does anyone know? Has it been tested?

Have also noted that when the Zeronet server has been operating for awhile, the number of trackers listed on the home screen declines. Why is this so? And why do those missing trackers return after Zeronet restart?

posts.subject: I've had problems obtaining ZeroID identities
posts.body:
Oftentimes ZeroID just tells you to come back. This morning, fetching an ID was almost instantaneous.

Passing this on because I believe this could be a serious issue for new users. If they can't get 08chan to work, they'll take their marbles and go home.

Don't know what the answer is. But the current system remains a problem.

posts.subject: The FBI encouraged a white supremacist to bomb a synagogue
posts.body:
How much of this is the public being put at risk so FBI can keep their jobs?

The FBI seems to have an uncanny talent for preying on the feeble minded and making sure their incoherent mumblings actually translate into concrete punishable acts. YOU WOULD NOT WISH TO LIVE IN AN AREA WITH AN FBI PRESENCE. ONE OF THESE DAYS THINGS WILL GO VERY BADLY FOR THE PUBLIC - AND THE FBI WILL COVER THEIR ASS. THESE MORONS ARE A MENACE.

On Friday, November 1, 2019, the FBI arrested a self-proclaimed white supremacist named Richard Holzer, who was allegedly planning to bomb Temple Emanuel in Pueblo, Coloradoâ€”the second-oldest synagogue in the state.

    Southern Colorado Man Charged With Federal Hate Crime For Plotting To Blow Up Synagogue

    Press release: https://t.co/8bFPqO1bct

    Pictured: U.S. Attorney Jason Dunn, FBI SAC Dean Phillips & Pueblo Police Chief Troy Davenport addressing members of the media pic.twitter.com/nyJOy1he9z

    â€” Colorado U.S. Attorney (@DCOnews) November 4, 2019

This is, largely, a good thing. After sleeping on the white supremacist infiltration of police departments all across the country, it's nice to see the FBI is actually taking action against this hugely dangerous epidemic. And there's absolutely no question that Richard Holzer was a white supremacist with violent intentions. As the Justice Department explained in a press release:

    Holzer, who self-identifies as a skinhead and a white supremacist, told undercover FBI agents that he wanted to do something that would tell Jewish people in the community that they are not welcome in Pueblo, and they should leave or they will die. The affidavit states that during a meeting with the undercover agents, Holzer repeatedly expressed his hatred of Jewish people and his support for RAHOWA, shorthand for a racial holy war.

Holzer also told the undercover FBI agents that he had already hired a "witch doctor" to "hex and poison" the water at the Temple, paying a Mexican cook to add arsenic into the pipes. It's unclear if this actually happened, or if it actually accomplished anythingâ€”but clearly, this guy was trouble. After befriending Holzer online, an undercover FBI agent actually went with him to case the Temple to plan for a potential attack. According to the affidavit, Holzer was the first one to bring up the idea to use Molotov Cocktails. He quickly realized that wouldn't be enough to do the damage that they wanted to. So naturally, the undercover FBI agent recommended using pipe bombs instead â€¦ which is how they managed to set up a sting operation to catch Holzer in the act of attempting to buy the pipe bombs that the undercover FBI agent offered to provide.

Holzer faces one charge of "attempting to obstruct persons in the enjoyment of their free exercise of religious beliefs, through force and the attempted use of explosives and fire," which is a federal hate crime.

On one hand, this is a plot reminiscent of the BlacKkKlansman story, complete with a team of undercover agents working to construct a whole elaborate personality. And they got the guy, so fuck yeah. On the other hand, the FBI has a long history of using these exact same tactics to entrap Muslim-Americansâ€”even planting evidence and arresting them when they don't comply with the pressures of the undercover agents.

The difference, of course, is that white supremacy and violent anti-Semitism are absolutely on the rise right now. So it's not quite the same as authorities targeting Muslims and black people just because of some perceived risk of subversionâ€”because they're part of a minority group that threatens the status quo, either by demanding fair treatment, or simply by existing. But it feels slightly gross and hypocritical to say, "Well, I'm okay with these tactics this time because I think they did the right thing for the right reasons. I just don't like it every other time." Because that sets a dangerous precedent.

posts.subject: Frontline - In the Age of AI (Nov 5, 2019) Cringeworthy
posts.body:
https://www.pbs.org/wgbh/frontline/film/in-the-age-of-ai/

I'll have a better copy in a few days and will post it here upon request for safekeeping.

Covers surveilance capitalism and the surveilance state. Also shows predictions of 50% job losses due to automation.

As always, the real question boils down to "who pays". Loss of freedom, loss of income, etc.

posts.subject: ABC news censorship of Epstein story
posts.body:
Project Veritas: https://www.projectveritas.com/2019/11/05/video-leaked-insider-recording-from-abc-news-reveals-network-executives-killed-bombshell-story-implicating-jeffrey-epstein/

Have mixed feelings about these 12 year old kiss and tell stories. On one hand, they do show corruption and blackmail at high levels. But I'm also quite tired of whores re-litigating their price. Especially when the indignant narration comes from a married/childless spinster:

Robach became engaged to former Melrose Place star Andrew Shue in September 2009, after meeting him at a book party the previous April.[11][12] They were married on Robach's 37th birthday, February 6, 2010, at The Lighthouse at Chelsea Piers, adjacent to the Hudson River.[13] Robach has three stepsons from her marriage to Andrew Shue, Nate (1997) Aidan (1999) and Wyatt (2004).[9]

Amy is not qualified to speak about procreation. And I'm pretty certain that she and her other MSM peers themselves whored at high levels for gain. Such people have no concept regarding the nitty gritty of creating replacements.

Epstein never bought the cow. That's bad for our species. With his money, he could have married them in a polygamous friendly country and those girls would have had offspring. Important, because I sense their sour grapes is in fact really rooted in the reality of being Epstein's discards. And of course I would hope he would refrain from pimping his wives (shaking head- you never know with these guys)?

It's clear too many powerful people have complicated lives ...... And worse, EVERY MSM news presenter  or reporter you see is likely a freakshow. Why would ANYONE get their facts from people like this?

And just fuck the royals! We fought a war to be rid of them. Who cares about inbred nothings? Ditto NYC. Petting zoo for freaks and criminals.

posts.body:
>>0e23ead3-574c-4861-bb40-5da78ec437a0
 Thanks for sharing. Had always believed the Tor recommendations were pretty hard. Now believe their concern may be one of capacity. They simply cannot get enough volunteers to run relays. It similar to the problem Zeronet has with seeders (lack of).

>>25c5ebca-8d53-4ea1-9c2a-11da3df58dad
Hmmm. Ancient arguments. Hard to prove for either party. The hedonist arguments might even be attractive in a universe lacking  bugs or old age death.

But that's not the world we live in. Half the population on some continents is mortally infected from hedonistic behavior - yet the birth rate keeps dropping. 

So any group which systematically fosters early exclusive mating, heavy fapping, with procreation will eventually dominate. Nature does not care about your fads and religions.

We might laugh at these two specimens posted if we knew their REAL story. Likely pathetic. "Come join me in my irrelevance".

>>6959545b-8db7-44aa-ba4b-5b560f1d39c5
I believe fastsurge. He's actually experimented. Done the work.  I could probably learn something from him. And stupid me, have run a relay for more than 10 years.

Doubt I could learn much from you.

>>6db80c4e-f204-45cd-9b1d-7aa0bf4457c6
EFF is filled with lefties, including many I'd actively butt heads with. But their deeds suggest they are honorable lefties (unlike the ACLU) who really DO believe in our Bill of Rights. EFF has a wary but cordial relationship with the NRA, and the NRA has joined them in court battles. If the EFF is getting money from Soros - hope they take all of it and leave him penniless.

>>7e3b11a3-4155-4cc3-894a-4e2715f8a651
Well, your Zeronet traffic may be traversing his network as early as next year.

That old refrain "be careful whose mess kit you shit in" applies.

>>056d4cce-a364-4bc1-85a4-132e2edccdf7

posts.subject: Wow. Youtube has gone nuts on everyone...Blocking/censoring
posts.body:
accounts who even mention "Eric Ciaramella". Facebook has done same.

https://twitter.com/Timcast

Many people had come to rely on Youtube as a new source free of corporatism. I knew of people who always pulled up citizen videos of world events just so they could "proof" what the MSM was telling them.

That was hard enough, but now these media people chase after you to force feed their narrative? I don't know if Zeronet can substitute for the MSM...but I sure wish more people would try. It's clear that all other sources are censored...so you never know what you are being fed.

Once believed some of my conspiracy minded friends were nuts. Now not so sure :( This should never have happened. I really do want Google and Facebook dead. The sooner the better.

There's a real shit storm going on out there, and many are trying to label it as pro Trump partisan backlash. It's more than that. And worse, neither side can now claim truth. No one trusts any of them.

posts.subject: Looks like DevilHS has fired off another salvo in the war for artistic freedom on twitter
posts.body:
(funny as hell)

Thumb on nose salute is alive and well in America. Go ahead, make more forbidden.

336
Posted by
u/Aurondarklord
unwoke bluepilled shapeshifting MOD
10 hours ago
Looks like DevilHS has fired off another salvo in the war for artistic freedom on twitter
TWITTER BS

Following the latest dogpile by the "WHERE ARE HER ORGANS!?" crowd over a Captain Marvel lewd, the man who started it all by refusing to budge for the mob has waded into the fray once again:

https://twitter.com/mr_devilhs/status/1193368028697772033

https://twitter.com/PabloRomeroArt/status/1190777116364877825

So far, in what DevilHS accurately described as a war "between erotic artists and crazy people", it's looking like, to my incredibly relief, art twitter is not just refusing to bend the knee, but actively fighting back to trigger the tumblr refugees into submission before these people, WHO NEVER SEEM TO FUCKING LEARN, manage to turn their new platform into a puritanical circlejerk just like they did to their old one...and inevitably cause the same result, then once again scream and wonder why THEIR porn is being banned and not just porn for people they hate.

I'm definitely starting to feel a change in the cultural winds here, more and more strongly. People are speaking up, fighting back, Get Woke Go Broke is working. But remember: any positive change we are seeing is the result of the fact SJWs promised companies a "wider audience" if they bent to their whims, and have failed to deliver it because they don't have the numbers, and they don't put their money where their mouths are. If we want to hang onto any gains we're making, we have to be better than that, we have to actually SUPPORT the people who give us what we want, buycotts are more effective than boycotts.

Oh and PS: To any lurking SJWs: NOW do you understand what it feels like to have a character you see as "for you" taken away and given to someone else? That rage you feel over fucking FANART that's not even canon, imagine how you'd feel if it were the company doing it to you. If, say, Disney actually redesigned Rey's outfit like DevilHS drew it, and either called Daisy Ridley in and told her "it's current year and we're chasing a different demographic, so go get yourself a mega boob job and do a fuckton of squats" or recast her. That's how it feels every time a character WE love gets censored or racebent or wokeified to appease you fucks. Sucks, doesn't it?

posts.body:

Why can't we just do this and quit talking about it? The jury is in, no one trusts these people. They are expensive too.

So why can't we summon the will to make these changes? I'm baffled.

I laughed myself silly over this one. It was inspired.

And I'll bet whoever did it has zero to do with any ideology. Was done only to trigger outrage and stab at the thought police.

Can't wait to witness their next fuckery.

posts.subject: 1.18 million senior officialsâ€™ spouses and children had emigrated between 1995 and 2005.
posts.body:
Since the late 1990s, growing numbers of Party officialsâ€™ children have emigrated to the United States. In 2012, Lin Zhe, a professor from the CCPâ€™s Central Party School and a member of the National Peopleâ€™s Congress, said that 1.18 million senior officialsâ€™ spouses and children had emigrated between 1995 and 2005.

The United States is the most popular destination for the children of high-ranking Party officials. In 2011, a netizen asserted on Chinese social media that almost 75 percent of ministerial-level Party officials had children who held U.S. citizenship or permanent residency, and that the number jumped to 91 percent among their grandchildren. The post was removed by censors within a minute of its publishing.

posts.subject: From Reddit datahoarder 12TB Best Buy Easystores
posts.body:
https://www.bestbuy.com/site/wd-easystore-12tb-external-usb-3-0-hard-drive-black/6364259.p?skuId=6364259
$179.99
Two controversies:

1. Are they firmware locked 14TB drives (binned rejects)?

2. Are they SMR drives?

>>bd963ae7-617a-4d80-baa6-fb17b5b045e2
>Zeronet is completely independent from a browser

This is the part which interested me. If Zeronet really works that way - this setup should have much less attack surface than Tor browsing. It's a good concept. Might make any Zeronet node on Tor truly hard to find.

Would never go so far as to claim anything is buttsniffer proof - but Zeronet is a good effort.

It would be good if some really hardcore security types waded through Zeronet's code looking for mistakes, then after publishing developed a "best practices" tutorial for setting up truly bulletproof nodes.

We also need to get the EFF more sharply focused on the 4th amendment. It should be damn near impossible to enter homes, and judges should grant perhaps 3ea warrants per year. That would lift the threat of wingnut content being used as an excuse for seizing hardware.

Failing changes in government overreach, the only solution remaining is hyperviolence. It should prey on the mind of any LE that they may not make it home given the abundance of examples where citizens fought to the death with tragic consequences. These red flag laws have provided a good start, but LE brains don't count citizen deaths - only their own. Don't believe we've yet seen any high LE body counts :(

That's what it will take. No reliance on corporate infrastructure - ever. Along with widespread infrastructure which is really out of anyone's reach.

This is doable if the American people have the will.

>>0c147376-e064-48d0-a051-16b777cb17e6

(meh) The double standard is always interesting. And this lawyer certainly is likely no stranger to putting her foot in her mouth.

Big secret? Many blacks don't like whites either. They talk trash too. And much of that trash is recorded and retrievable.

Looking at this situation dispassionately as one can, still would have been nice if that lawyer had conducted an experiment. Stayed in her job just to see what that school might have done to chase her out. Have no doubt that her position in the job market is enhanced by not "doing the conflict". But conflict is often necessary to get to the truth.

So where do we draw the line when people behave badly or stupidly? Or do we continue with capricious punishment from an unwritten rule book?

Inquiring minds would like to know.

posts.subject: Haunted by this: First they came......
posts.body:
First they came for the Communists
And I did not speak out
Because I was not a Communist

Then they came for the Socialists
And I did not speak out
Because I was not a Socialist

Then they came for the trade unionists
And I did not speak out
Because I was not a trade unionist

Then they came for the Jews
And I did not speak out
Because I was not a Jew

Then they came for me
And there was no one left
To speak out for me 

The Jews adopted it as their own, but I suspect someone was using it 3000 yrs ago. It's that basic a comment on human affairs. Not only theirs.

So I have a confession: 

Don't use drugs, would be very upset if anyone in my family was using them, and I'd probably hunt you down and kill you if you infected my kids with drugs. JUST because I'd want to - even after I acknowledge the fault was my family's alone.

That said, have long cringed at these "no-knock" raids LE usually inflicts upon black people. It's such a fundamental violation of our Bill of Rights and should NEVER happen.

Always made peace with it by observing that black people accepted it. Just like they accept money for blood after some nitwit shoots their kin. Still slaves.

But LE these days has become more bold. Whites are suffering the same treatment now. It's blatant - the contempt that government often has for citizens. Wonder/fear this is Karma - for not raising hell for the first no knock raid.

Anyone else out there sick about this? Even for those you don't have any special sympathy for? Did we get what we deserved?

posts.subject: Drug users - who's in favor of leaving them alone?
posts.body:
While making sure the price of their vice declines to the point where they can easily OD?

Cuts the cartels off from the bucks.
Likely would cut property crime.
Might make it easier to compartmentalize the damage from their demise - since it would strain that family's finances much less.

How on earth did "conservatives" come up with a rationale which allows them to lock up citizens when no other citizens were harmed? Sounds like something right out of a leftist's coercion playbook? What's next? Jail time if you fail to change the oil in your car?

Similarly, why are taxpayers hit with Narcan expenses? Why don't we have a specific choice for this frivolous expense?

Convince me that respecting their body sovereignty AND letting them die from their own decision isn't the most correct and viable response?

Addicts die. Yet we have millions employed to stop them. Time to try something else? Correct our fundamental disrespect toward citizens?

posts.subject: Trevor Loudonâ€™s 2019 list of socialists and communists in Congress
posts.body:
Disclaimer...haven't researched any of this, and all of us should be skeptical when confronted with "facts" provided by partisans.

But it's safe to say, some of these people are likely to be real communists. And they have that right as American citizens. No matter how revolted you may be about it.

They still face a line citizens have been soft to enforce. Our Bill of Rights. And that's really the best strategy for controlling social "enforcers". 

What they believe doesn't mean shit - if they can't execute on it.

posts.subject: Would just make it easier if you need to kill him.
posts.body:
https://www.campusreform.org/?ID=13975

First rule of outrageous statements? Don't get caught.

Violence always settles the affairs of men. "Where is your university god now?"

Pol Pot reformed Cambodia as a new, one-party state called Democratic Kampuchea. Seeking to create an agrarian socialist society, his government forcibly relocated the urban population to the countryside to work on collective farms. Those regarded as enemies of the new government, including Buddhist monks and ethnic minorities, were killed. These mass killings, coupled with malnutrition, strenuous working conditions, and poor medical care, killed between 1.5 and 2 million people, approximately a quarter of Cambodia's population, a period later termed the Cambodian genocide.

Bet those rural dwellers were told to eat cake too.

>>39a0bcee-1b6f-4c39-bba3-c5c407653afd
>>39a0bcee-1b6f-4c39-bba3-c5c407653afd
">Lager. Tor Browser (or firefox) still exposed and lots of options for de-anonymizing attacks. On top of that, the attack surface of zeronet itself which can leak your clearnet IP and what content you're seeding if it's compromised."

Sure wish we could get the definitive judgement on this. What you describe doesn't make sense to me because the Zeronet  server should serve as an intermediary. Tor browser talking only to it (unless you open another tab to an onion site). Browser should not have any role "touching" non local Zeronet sites. Zeronet seems to install new SSL certs at every startup, so I doubt it needs the 6 point onion connection for security anyway..just anonymization. That's good because if Zeronet is still using V2 onions...things are out of date.

>>b3ba25ab-fad5-4ef3-a185-82177168cb0e
>hide
>>b3ba25ab-fad5-4ef3-a185-82177168cb0e
>lul check out these delusions of importance

Dunno. Not a day passes when you don't hear about the latest twitter outrage and all the people who made it their business. And I'm pretty sure a lot of over indebted government employees REALLY can't afford to lose their buttsniffing job. So they'd likely do ANYTHING they can to gin up your transfer of cat photos. Within this Henny Penny world..it's not difficult to raise innocuous things into importance. Profitable too.

For chrissake - look what they've done to weather. Always wanted to throw a big rat into those newsrooms :)

posts.subject: AOC suggests her questioning of Mark Zuckerberg led to Twitter banning political ads
posts.body:
https://reclaimthenet.org/aoc-twitter-ad-ban/amp/

We really should put some gold stars on her report card, then give her extra stickers.

(Mark was just impressed with her rainbow farts)

>>fb8cac14-39e5-4921-9ba5-387204330cc9

Again, the browser itself should (?) be well protected since it never contacts those zites by itself and the server is forced to contact only through tor.

I see a bigger problem with Zeronet which has not been talked about here. It's power hungry. When seeding is fast - it will totally consume several CPU cores. Now I understand how torrenting can be demanding after downloading and hosting that 1.2TB Hong Kong protest torrent, but Zeronet is beyond that. Places even greater demands on the host system.

So part of the dearth of Zeronet popularity may simply be it's demands. Few are willing to pay this price.

posts.subject: Hotwheel's vitriol is stunning as is his SJW crowd
posts.body:
https://twitter.com/HW_BEAT_THAT

Now I've never posted on 8chan and don't intend to start...but this whole episode illustrates just how shaky free speech is in 2019. Worldwide.

>>4d9efc42-90fe-42c6-ba99-6b1d7f088b49
>>4d9efc42-90fe-42c6-ba99-6b1d7f088b49
>You can be sure, that those are the lowest of low tier.

Not so sure. Have shucked a bunch, and use quite a few with the native USB 3 port. All have been fine. There's a whole raft of people who have done/do same.

Now I'm certain WD is binning them, but with today's error correction and profiling - may not matter.

It's very hard to come up with statistically rigorous reliability data when models change so much. A lot of hearsay is just "fooled by randomness".

>>b6300933-6689-47c3-8bd3-55503975b7e6
And you need a religion because....?

Why not just start making babies and fu-get-about-it?

posts.subject: Fullerton City Officials Target Local Bloggers in Lawsuit, Want to Search Private Computers
posts.body:
People's republic of Kalifornia

Clearnet blogs are not for little people.

Ferguson is mindful that he has the full legal power of the city aimed right at his front door, noting the temporary restraining order request is putting stress on his personal life, including his family and his work. 

â€œTheyâ€™re targeting my former coworker and my employer only because they donâ€™t like the blog. And itâ€™s really frustrating because theyâ€™re doing anything they can to retaliate against us,â€ Ferguson said Thursday. â€œBecause the city broke the law and I filed a lawsuit to stop them from breaking the law â€” they retaliated.â€ 

â€œMy entire family gets put under an enormous amount of stress. Do I still have a job tomorrow? I donâ€™t know, because theyâ€™re going after my employer,â€ Ferguson said, adding nobody at his work is involved in the blog. 

The city alleges Ferguson and others on the blog illegally accessed its DropBox account â€” a cloud-based storage service â€” and downloaded numerous files.

â€œThe complaint arises from alleged illegal and unauthorized access to a City shared file account in which the defendants repeatedly accessed, downloaded, and published without permission documents and files related to various topics, including but not limited to privileged or otherwise protected communications and documents relating to City of Fullerton internal personnel investigations and actions,â€ read a late Thursday night news release issued by Fullerton city officials.

posts.subject: Banned TED Talk: Nick Hanauer "Rich people don't create jobs"
posts.body:
Why does anyone attempt censorship? It always leaks, and the perp always looks bad.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CKCvf8E7V1g

Via Business Insider: "As the war over income inequality wages on, super-rich Seattle entrepreneur Nick Hanauer has been raising the hackles of his fellow 1-percenters, espousing the contrarian argument that rich people don't actually create jobs. The position is controversial â€” so much so that TED is refusing to post a talk that Hanauer gave on the subject. National Journal reports today that TED officials decided not to put Hanauer's March 1 speech up online after deeming his remarks "too politically controversial" for the site...".

>>87a2efd0-894c-49c3-87cd-9c4d66b1ce77
Guess you failed their cut

How does it feel failing to achieve parasite?

>>d930b123-88cb-4eda-8825-a3393704f509
>Backblaze being one. 4 times a year they release stats and lifespan on every had drive bought, installed and replaced

Their data often doesn't correlate well with consumer experience. Perhaps because the duty factor difference is so enormous?

Disk drive manufacturers never installed that primo forward errorcorrection used for deep space missions - but the stuff they use is already so good. Anyone with a hash based storage system will conclude that disk error correction today is very good. You never see bitrot.

posts.subject: Howto increase your tracker count and keep it current ....
posts.body:
https://cheapskatesguide.org/articles/zeronet-six-months.html
http://127.0.0.1:43110/15CEFKBRHFfAP9rmL6hhLmHoXrrgmw4B5o/


Many newcomers to ZeroNet worry that their computers will not be able to see enough bit-torrent trackers to maintain a stable connection to the rest of the content on ZeroNet. I use the list of trackers found on the Syncronite zite on ZeroNet at this address: http://127.0.0.1:43110/15CEFKBRHFfAP9rmL6hhLmHoXrrgmw4B5o/ . This list is updated regularly, and it is much larger than the default list that comes with the ZeroNet software, so it will allow you to have a greater pool of peers with which to potentially connect. This will give you a more robust connection to the rest of the content on ZeroNet. To use this list, simply go to ZeroHello, Click on the three vertical dots near the upper left-hand corner, select "configuration", and in the "Trackers" box paste the link to a list of trackers that is found on Syncronite's main page.

>>e703caae-0776-4b88-92b7-37efc27e64c8

If you have any especially good ones - post the text here please :)

posts.subject: Easy path to build hardened Tor middle relay ....
posts.body:
You first build this firewall: https://www.ipfire.org/

Then you click the Tor entry on their update system "Pakfire". It installs your relay with a Gui. Ipfire claims that installing Tor automatically opens the two Tor ports, but I had to manually open mine. You open from the Red interface to the Red interface which lets your relay "see" the internet.

Once this is done, you need only set this box up on the DMZ of your present router. Alternately, you can replace your current router with this one. I've done it both ways. Each method has advantages.

The coder behind this box has released gooberisms, but he's also very conscientious and actually READS the Spectre CPU flaw papers so he can mitigate those flaws when possible. Do you know of anyone else facing up to Spectre?
